string.text: What's there to learn here? Well, it's a bit like kindergarten... except that if you don't pay attention, you'll get your ass kicked in the Zone, and fast. You gotta learn the steps if you wanna dance with the Devil and live to tell about it. There's lots of gear lying around - guns, ammo, you name it - so feel free to grab what you need.

Just waiting for these here fine soldiers to go on a lunch break or something. Gotta get to the Big Land, but no luck gettin' past these cunning bastards so far. And I'm not the only guy trying, ya know?

The stripers have been looking for something nearby. No one’s been going here at all, everything had been licked clean way before me, not even a single cable left. I guess something’s come to hand... I didn’t even get anywhere close to the building, got popped at. I was lucky to get away with no holes in my skin.
It’s alright. I’m just trying to survive, that’s all.

We’re knocking up a team of machos who don’t pee in their pants at the idea of going underground in the Zone. There is this old plant, and all sorts of communication lines under it; they say there’s lots of cool stuff that we could lay our hands on. Not to mention the excitement…
It’s not new, it’s old! They say Hawkeye used to have his old base here… I wonder if we find any traces of those days gone by if we give it a good rummage…
To think of that, I was up the creek just an hour ago! I mean, it was all peace and quiet here six months ago, and now these skinheads in their sweats are hiding behind ever tree! Crap!.

You’re lucky, stalker, the bandits didn’t touch you; their base is right nearby. If it were up to me, I’d raze it to the ground… But for now we are just keeping an eye on it. This is their secondary base, the main one is closer to the center of the Zone.

There’s a rumor that there used to be a major laboratory here, top secret and all that… Oh well… On the one hand, if we could just find the entrance, it’d probably packed with swag! But on the other hand, it’s pretty creepy…

Did you know that before the disaster there used to be a research complex in what we now call the Dark Valley? And underground, mind you. I’m not sure exactly what its purpose was, but I doubt it was to cure cancer, if you see what I mean. They tell all sorts of stuff about it, and none of it sounds good to me. Well, it’s actually very creepy.

Why? What do you want to hear? Here’s what I’ll say: sure, the Duty guys are the cops, but they do know how to put the house in order, you have to hand it to them. I don’t feel too good about them, though. Bossing everyone around, don’t take this, don’t carry out that… What is more, they’ve actually worked out rules on what you can say in the Big Land and what you can’t! Rumor has it they’re actually scheming to wipe out the Zone completely. Now that doesn’t surprise me, they are soldiers after all, even if no longer in the army… well, let them dream on! The worst thing, though, is that they seem to be backed up by the power structures themselves.

This territory is now run by Duty and the law here is the Duty code. We are guarding the Zone borders and cooling down hotheads. The romantic jackasses come in by truckloads… and then they go dropping like flies the very first day.

Have you been to our transshipment hub? It’s not just for us, though, you can meet all sorts of chaps here. It’s a good place though, none of the lousy shit you get in the Zone, and all the news ends up here anyway. You can always hear something helpful or just chew the cud. If only I hadn’t missed Baldy; he left with his group the other day, so I didn’t get to see him this time.

If it's information you need, you'd better get your ass to the camp. We get all the rookies like you here. Some come to get the low down. Others hang out here when they need a break from the action. That's real soldiers next to us. No need to shit your pants yet, but don't try pissing these guys off either, alright? They'd blow your head off without as much as a wink. There's a place by the trader's - that's our local mall around here. You can make camp there no problem.

This place is safe now, stalker, and this is the way we are trying to keep it. There are lots of folks here all the time: some have settled down and don’t pry any further than the outskirts, others are gearing up for yet another raid. I wish Mohawk hadn’t perished; he surely enjoyed setting rookies like you on the right track.

Did you hear Duty are recruiting again? I gave it some thought, but then I decided: what the hell do I need it for, back to the drills? The discipline and all that crap… No thanks, I already did my two years, I had it up to here…
If you aren’t up on it yet, we are recruiting more people. If you’ve got some experience under your belt, you won’t regret it. Ask for Petrenko at the base.

So you too have come to look at the fights, eh, stake a little on someone?.. Holla, there’s an arena nearby, and you don’t know zilch about it! Here’s the deal: the Duty guys catch the mutants, right? After the research, if the beasts are still alive, they send them out to the arena. The ogres are never the same, too: you could die laughing at the sight of some of them, and others will make you pee in your pants.

The arena has just got some fresh meat. The folks get their entertainment, and we deserve to make a little money on the bets. And then again, it’s just another reminder for the stalkers that the Duty are not just throwing words around, but actually doing something.

I say, have you already checked out Rostok? Used to be a quiet place, but these days I wouldn’t go there alone: it’s nothing but a wild area, way too many mutants. Why don’t we team up, eh?.. But on the other hand… I don’t know you, you don’t know me. Anything could happen. Sorry, mate. You go your way and I go mine.
We've been to Rostok. I don't recommend going there, especially if you're alone. If you cherish life, you keep away from there.

Well, I wanted to check out Yantar, but got an unexpected surprise. The eggheads have set up a nothing less than a scientific outpost in the Zone. Who knows what they are rummaging in, while dozens of deadites walk around the complex. Idyllic, by golly.

Cleaned out the Yantar area the other day… blipped off a legion of those rotten beasts! The research labs are stationed there, but the deadites are really fond of that place, too. So we give the scientists a helping hand every once in a while.

Right by the old warehouses - you know the place? - that's where the Freedom base is. Now those are some fun, hearty people; it’s a rare pleasure to crack a bottle with them. And none of those Duty bozos looming around like at the bar.

There’s this old factory nearby; we’ve been kicking those bandits out of there time and again, but they just keeping turning back up! It hasn’t even been a month since the last fight, and here they are again. You’d better watch out there…
Freedom are holed up behind the old warehouses… damn those stoned loafers…
You’d better leave before nighttime. You can more or less get by in daytime, but as soon as the sun sets…
Get out of here, stalker! We’re about to remove the cordon. We only maintain it during the day and leave at night when it gets too crappy.
You see, at night you need to take cover, and the stronger the door the better. At nighttime we pretty much end up in a state of siege.
I say, buddy, you’re still not posted on the rules? If you wanna sleep, you do it somewhere else. Here, even if you pack a grenade launcher, you won't be safe!
You know what? Let those Duty and Freedom guys and looters and others of their kind sort out whose it is, I couldn’t care less! To hell with it all…
We’re working here now, stalker. As if all the slimeballs weren't enough, all we need is these Merc bastards and the Freedom retards on top of everything…
I have to warn you this place is pretty dangerous at night, too. Skirmishes break out from time to time; as far as I see it, the local bandit gangs are in the middle of a war.

Now tell me: whatever side you look at it, this is our territory, right? We are the ones holding off the entire skunk swarming here from the Zone, right? Let those eggheads carry on with their studies, no one’s gonna touch them, but Duty and the looters better piss off!
Don’t you know? They’ve made a new path here to carry the swag straight to the border bypassing Duty patrols. Start from Yantar, then sneak through to Agroprom and you’ve made it!

Nothing. I know nada. I’m just scratching along, working hard for my daily bread. I’m not into roaming the Zone, to hell with it. No work at home, wife nagging all the time… I mean, I have to live somehow! One day of rummaging at the Dump and you can dig up some minor artifacts. Just enough to get something to eat and to drink.
And just what do you think you are doing here? Heading for Yantar or smuggling artifacts on the sly past the bar?

I’m not going to conceal the fact that your colleagues, the stalkers, do offer some rather curious anomalous formations from time to time… Artifacts you call them. This area is a rather lively smuggling route, due to, in no small part, to a lack of firm control over these items.

What are you saying, man? C’mon, we’ve laid the track to bypass the Duty hot-shots if you want to sneak out to the Big Land! Well, they do saunter about here quite a bit, but as far as they’re not in the know we can at least go around them.

I’m just back from Yantar. I thought I could sell something to science, as always, but they’re all locked up in the bunkers, hardly ever peeping out even in daytime, except for yet another chopper. So if you’re heading that way, you might as well forget it, it's not worth the hassle…
They’re doing some research in the Yantar area, but the place is swarming with deadites now. We’re here to guard the entries.

I really don’t know what to tell you. I thought about going back to our complex in Yantar, I’m sure you’ve heard of it. And here they're telling me that while it used to be merely dangerous, now it’s absolutely impossible to get through. Do you think they could be exaggerating?

I’ve been to Yantar and I must say: those scientists are wasting away: frightened to death, hiding… The only thing that keeps them alive is the aid thrown in by the choppers. But then again, there really are way more deadites in there now. You live among them for a week and you’ll probably be in a blue funk yourself. A rotten little place.
Forget it, hanging out with deadites! This bloody complex is swarming with them, and they keep flocking in, more and more with every passing day.
We’re trying to block the advance of the deadites from the laboratory complex. To tell you the truth we’ll be more than happy if you join us, as we don’t have that many people…
You know, we are collecting various data… I am personally researching the main propagation paths of the quasiliv… I mean, deadites, as you call them. Would you share your observations with us?

It's like, you know... You can try your luck here, at the Dump, but it ain't a goldmine. Some like to go deeper into the Zone. Better pickings there, sure, but you gotta know what your doing. No place for a rookie, that. Not without proper gear. No, Sir.
Have you tried shooting down the deadites creeping out the lab facilities? Just look at them: couldn’t care less, don’t feel any pain, totally brainless creatures!
I’m going to the lab for a job interview! Relax, man, it’s a joke… If you wander in there, you’re end up dead or turn into a zombie.
I’m warning you: the lab is a no-go area. Well, if you really want to, sure, I’m not going to hold you back. But no one comes back from there alive.

You see… I would like to warn you. You really shouldn’t go to the lab. Well, no one should, for that matter. If has to do with some fundamental modifications in human psyche and metabolism, and, I’m afraid, they are absolutely irreversible.

Hey! Lemme break you out… I mean, break you in… anyway, save you like a lost lamb. Here’s the deal, man: don’t rush to the lab complex. That place is full of shit, all kinds of bad shit. People vanishing, and then all of a sudden coming to you at night. It’s not some vampire fairy tale; this is the truth about the deadites. That’s it.

Have you seen those smart-alecs, the pick of those United damn Nations? They’ve been under some real panic attack lately. Can’t walk two steps from the base without a regiment on guard with APCs and choppers.
None of your business! Don’t bug anyone with dumb questions and no one will bug you.

You see, normally we don’t leave the bunker without proper security; we just can’t do it in view of these environmental conditions. I’m a sort of an exception. I’m not into large expeditions, all this hassle, the army… But I’m afraid nothing I could tell you would be of any interest.

Those eggheads are really something! They crack me up, man! Usually they won’t even stick their noses out of the bunker. But if they do, like they did the other day, boy do they make a stir! Grunts all over the place, choppers, armor! The only thing they’re lacking is a battleship or at least an armored train…

I’ve been hanging around here for three days now, watching. The lab is here, right? No one has been in it since the very beginning. Duty took care of the deadites on the surface, and that was quite a while ago, right? But now the scientists are sticking their heads in there. So they must’ve found a way to protect themselves, whatever it is you need protection from… So I’m trying to figure out what’s what, there’s probably more swag than you can carry.

We had hordes of nasties coming out of the Black Valley these last few days. Dunno what gave them the scare, but they sure ain't stopping for another look. Plus, there's mutants multiplying like cockroaches in the Eastern sector - we barely manage to kill them off. That's all the news we've got.

And what are you snooping around here for? Fancy going to the lab, too? Heard the tales about miraculous devices and heaps of artifacts? Damn it, just when are you dumheads going to rid the world of your stinking presence?

I’m working here, young man. I’m just working, doing my duty for the science and humanity. And in case you want to learn something about the deserted laboratory, and every stalker I meet suspects me of hiding some horrible secrets, I’ll say that I don’t know anything and don’t even want to know! I am not and never have been interested in this subject, do I make myself clear?!
Do you know if those eggheads really invented something? I wonder what they’re hiding in that bloody lab. Even if there’s no decent swag, it would still be great to know.

I’ve been thinking… Maybe I should go and join Freedom? There’s their base, at the former military warehouse… Why not? They seem pretty smart, and even if they are a little on the wild side, so much the better for me: I don’t need any of this discipline crap, I know what to do, it’s not my first month in the Zone…

You have a liking for those Freedom guys, don’t you? Alright, alright, no offence. I’m pretty sure we’ll knock them out of those warehouses in no time. No organization or discipline… They’re just a herd. A led herd at best. And they think they can go against us, dumb NATO nippers…

I often hang out with this one Duty guy, when we’re not fighting, that is. He’s a smart fellow, but way too narrow-minded. You see, we stick to a totally different philosophy: the Zone can only be tamed, assimilated, not wiped out. To do that, you need access to all the information there is: sooner or later someone will think up something useful. But they...they only know one thing: "shut it down", "forbid", "top secret"… That’s stupid, by golly, downright stupid. But then again, I can understand them: when you’ve got all the cogs and gears of the State turning behind you, you’re not even supposed to think otherwise.
There’s this little farmstead, it used to be quiet, but now there’s all sorts of crap. You’d better go the long way around, like I intend to do… Look out, I warned you.
I want to warn you right away, stalker: the bloodsuckers have made a nest in the village. There might be something even worse, so you’d better watch out.

There’s not much news around here… The artifacts have long been gone, and those houses over there used to be occupied by bloodsuckers, so we could pound them down with all that we've got. But when I tried to walk that way I just couldn’t do it. I don’t know if it’s intuition holding me, but I just can’t. No way. I sense death there…
I’m getting the hell out of here! I’ve done my four weeks at the Barrier, and that’s it, I’ve had it! Some crud slogs from the Brain Burner day and night, growing more and more aggressive every day…

Many have turned to scavenging. Before no one ever looked for anything at the Dump, the radiation was so high, you would get your eggs would boiled in half an hour. But now that swag is melting away, they just wrap themselves up in protection, take some chemo pills and go on looking. You can dig up all sorts of stuff in there, but mostly trinkets.
If you’re going to join us here at the barrier, then you’re my man. But if not, you’d better bugger off! We need real men, not some loafers. We’ve got enough of those ourselves…

Are you heading for the barrier, man? That’s cool, they could do with another decent fellow over there. We started this thing and were holding up pretty good…but then all those beasts started coming out of nowhere! We're holding on by the skin of our teeth, so every gun counts.
Aren't you up on it? The way to the center of the Zone is open! We don’t know how it happened, on its own or someone took care of it, bless his heart. Now we can scoop up some real swag!

Why don't you halt for a while, stalker. Don’t follow the crowd. Tell me: do you know what’s there? Right, you don’t. You don’t know whether you’ll find some swag there or not. You have no idea what kind of traps might be there. So why are you all charging in there like a bunch of pricks?!
The way to the center is clear, you got it?! Now you can walk straight to the center! Everyone’s gonna rush in there. We’d better get their first so we can skim the cream off!
Go on and see for yourself! Don’t you want to see what’s over there? You must be a lunatic then. There’s got to be so much swag! Say, have you heard about the Wish Granter?
You’re just like kids, by golly! "Wish Granter", "Artifacts Klondike"… Bunch of crap!
Hey, man, I want to see for myself what’s hiding behind the horizon! What if I could just get down to the nitty-gritty of all this crap they call the Zone?
See those apartment buildings? That’s Pripyat. Right behind it, there is the nuclear power plant. If I could only get there… but who knows what’s roaming among those houses now.

Here’s the deal. That over there is Pripyat. The Chernobyl NPP is beyond Pripyat. Nobody knows what’s going on or who could be living there. We’re better off right here. We always have something to feed on, that’s the way it’s always been.

How would I know! I’m just heading for the bar to shoot the breeze. Haven’t you been there yet? For crying out loud! Alright, from where you’re right now go straight North. The bar is only a stone throw from here. The bar is the right place to hang out, especially for rookies like you: the old-timers usually drop by, they could break you in. Except… you’re sure to run into our Duty squad… Well, with good luck, chances are you’ll hit it off.
Pripyat! Pinch my arm, man! Finally! So we’re right by the power plant now. But then again, I don’t know who you might run into, what kind of a beast is out to get you…
Listen, bud… Do you hear this voice in your head, or is it just me going haywire? It just keeps babbling on and on…

Oh no, not another one… I’m telling you for the umpteenth time, people here are under some telepathic influence. Some voice in their heads keep luring them into the center of the Zone promising it will grant any wish of the one who dares to touch… whatchamacallit… oh yeah, some monolith.
Can you hear the voice? It’s just like having a song in your head! I wish I could change the track though: come to me, it says, and I’ll make you happy. Same thing over again for two hours now.
Can’t you guess? You’re trying to get to the station too, aren’t you? For the same reason as we are, that’s nothing new!! If only we could put those possessed lame-brains out of the way…
The station site is fast by! We’re still trying to crush Monolith resistance!
Here it is, the Chernobyl NPP, close at hand. We’re almost there, but these tough slimeballs won’t let us through! Alright, we’re gonna make it hot for them now!

Listen, bud, do you know anything about Agroprom? I thought about going there, but they made a laughing-stock of me, saying there’s nothing left but anomalies, the place’s been cleared out. Do you know if it’s the truth, or did they just take me for a ride? I mean, I’m new here and believe everything the locals say… What if they just conspired to make fun of me? They won’t miss a chance to laugh their heads off, damn pricks!
Halt! Take a break, you’ll still make it. The Monolith are everywhere; they know the town inside out, ambushes at every turn. Be careful.
I’m warning you: right now most of the town is controlled by the Monolith. Ambushes everywhere: they know this place like the back of their hands. So stay alert and double-check your gun.
You know what I’d love to do? I’d carpetbomb this town. Those buggers wouldn’t think twice before booby-trapping a sandbox or a flowerpot. So many people died because of these assholes!

I don’t know about this Wish Granter … What if it’s not eternal, so it won’t last for everyone? And then what, get down on all fours? Well I promise to you, man, if we get there, you’ll go right after me…

Duty has got to break through to the center among the first, if not the very first! Can you imagine some psycho - and you’re all here schizo, paranoic or oligophrenic in some way or another - gets to this piece of shit that can really grant any wish? And what happens next?!

The news of the century: everyone’s here, all who can walk and hold a gun! I mean… anything you wish could come true here! Do you get it, buddy? Anything you wish! What if someone says: "I want the Zone to disappear now and forever, amen". Eh? Do you grasp the scope of this shit? We’ll all be knocked up! Everyone!

News? Who wants news when we’re neck deep in old shit? Those damn bandits have been really asking for it! After all, it’s the stalkers who risk their lives hunting for artifacts in all the anomalies, but no, Sir, they want someone else’s swag… Stinking vermin! Stay away from the Dump, that’s their place.

I’m stuck here, you get it? Stuck! I want to go home, but they won’t let me through, and that’s all the news… Those who burrow deep into the Zone, the old-timers, they tell lots of stories. And the swag they bring, it'll blow your mind. They say there are some places littered with artifacts. You only need to bend down to pick them up. Very few stalkers dare go that far, and even fewer come back with swag.

Otter got fried at the Brain Burner a week ago. It would be one thing if he'd been a rookie, a scatter-brained greenhorn, but he had been stalking for donkey's years! They say he was even in Hawkeye’s gang, too. Who would’ve thought…
I’m not really up to speed on that.

Tell me one thing, stalker: why do you loners go nuts sometimes? Is it for lack of real discipline or something? Say, this one guy last week thought he’d take a stroll to the Burner. They say he was experienced, too… He could’ve lost his brains much easier: stick the gun in his mouth and shoot!

Those bastards… the Mercs. They’ve been drinking our blood all this time and now they’ve switched to the eggheads. What the hell do they want with them? For the ransom? Or trying to chip in for the Nobel prizes?

The Mercs became more active in the last couple of weeks. We also call them the looters. Yeah, we’ve got this shit here too, if you haven’t heard of them yet. They’re just like bandits, except they’re better organized. The thing is, they’d always been after stalkers, but now they go after the scientists, too. Be vigilant or they could very well put a bullet in your head.
I hear some rumors that the eggheads have dug up something really amazing. So everybody’s making a big fuss: the army, the Mercs and Duty are not far behind…

If you’re up to the same thing that everyone’s been buggering me about for the last two days, I’m telling you: leave me alone! If I knew anything and wouldn’t be under oath, I’d tell you all. But I don’t, do not know a damn thing! What have those eggheads dug up, where are our bosses gobe? What have I got to do with it?! They’re on vacation, they don’t report to us!

Ha! Everyone’s kicking up a shindy! Confederate is back from the raid with his group, and you should see all the artifacts they brought! Well sure, Confederate is holding his tongue and won’t spill the beans, same old thing, but his guys keep cracking up saying they’ve taken a ride to the Yukon mines and scored some swag… Damn bastards!

All sorts of scum have been flocking from the Burner for several days now. They guys have built up a barrier by the old warehouses; they seem to be doing alright so far. If the scum keeps up the pace we'll have no other choice but to give a helping hand at the barrier…
Did you hear all this babble about the Zone expanding? I think it’s all true: I’ve recently seen beasts that I used to see much closer to the center before. That’s some piece of shit, eh?

Well, maybe the bloodsuckers really have come close to the Zone’s border. But what does that have to do with the Zone expansion? So what if a little herd shot through… alright, we overlooked. But we work days and nights on end! And getting our job done, too. No one has been screaming outside the perimeter: "Help us, we’re surrounded by mutants!"

It’s all pretty sad. The other day Otter went missing for nothing, still can’t believe it… Oh, you probably haven’t even heard about Otter, right? Well, he was as good as a professor, had been hanging around here since the very first year, knew the Zone like the back of his hand… and who would’ve thought? No matter how experienced a stalker you are, still the Zone gets you. Some actually decide to go to the Big Land.

Do you think the Barman’s posted on what those scientists have discovered? Listen, what if he’s come to terms with them scientists? Think of it, he’s been scouting around for experienced stalkers and sending them on some weird missions. Doesn’t explain anything, just says go here or there… and those are all rotten places, no one’s ever brought any swag from there. What are they all snooping around for?
Something creepy is bound to happen. The deadites that never came out in daylight before are now rambling around the woods. What’s with all this crap?

The deadites all of a sudden got more aggressive and agile. There was a time when we could eliminate them from the complex itself, and now we’re just trying to guard the entrance. But I haven’t leaked a word, you get it?
Watch out, these walking corpses have infested the whole area. They are dumb and aggressive. We’re on our guards day and night. So this place is pretty dangerous, young man.

Aha, I bet those eggheads have blown up something in their lab. Before, you couldn’t even see a deadite anywhere, but now they’re just streaming from the complex. By the look of things, they seem to have lost something.
Rumor has it that the scientists have actually talked one of our gang into going down to the lab. They gave him something… some protective shit… But that’s it, no more details.
They say all sorts of things. Like, some lunatic made a deal with the scientists and went down to the laboratory for them. Now that’s some dumb dork for you!
Here’s the joke of the week! The eggheads hooked one of your guys on a major payment, so he went down to the lab with some device of theirs. Another damn sacrifice on the altar of science!
I think something is really cooking in there. Those eggheads have dug up something that is sending everyone up the wall. And that’s the end of our quiet days too.
Who knows? But they’ve been kicking us about twice as much: first they surround, then they clean up… And there are ten times as many soldiers in the Zone now.

It’s all pretty sad, that’s what I’ll say. There’ve always been plenty of people by the border, half of them never even go into the Zone, and there’ll never be enough artifacts for everyone. The labs, the plants - everything has already been taken apart and carried out. Soon we’ll be left with nothing to do, except maybe open a restaurant… with a view and exotic cuisine.
I really don’t know what to tell you… Something’s always the matter, that’s the way it’s always been. Sure, they don’t think so in the Big Land, but you and I live here, in the Zone…

The eggheads are nosing about. Who knows what sort of secret they’ve already dug up, but they sure keep the army busy! They’re all over Agroprom and the Dark Valley, rummaging about, searching and searching…

There’s more and more scum coming from behind the Burner, and here are Duty and Freedom up for another row. They go and kill each others, what’s the point, I'm asking. We won't last here at the Barrier left to our own devices!
The mutants are trying harder to break through the barrier. It’s getting really tough. If someone would just cut out loafing, we would do those beasts in right away!

Duty are bawling about their super-deeds at the barrier from every rooftop. As if anyone believes them… We were the ones who started this thing; we carry on, and look how many loners like you have volunteered to stay. Damn those pricks!

I hear Duty have been really making trouble. As if they are "the volunteers acting to maintain order and safety in the Zone"… yeah right, volunteers! You’d flip out if you saw the brand spanking new guns some sponsor had donated to these volunteers. They’re just as corrupt as everyone else.
What’s the rumor? I’ll tell you without any rumors: we’re about to bring some order here. We’ll clean the Zone from these freaks, and some jerks too…
Did you hear what Duty are planning to do with us? Mincemeat, or so I've heard. That really worries me… Not to mention that they’ve re-equipped themselves first rate.

The news? We’re sitting here, the beasts are coming at us, we're shooting them down, and they’re coming again, more and more. We’ve seen some military choppers, though… and it seems they’ve actually gone beyond the Burner.

We don’t get much news around here… same old stuff, same old gang. Mutants, Freedom… although, we’ve been seeing a lot of the military choppers. And you’d think they’d fire at the beasts at least once! No way…

What’s new… They tell lots of things, but you can’t believe everything they say. Like, they say some old stalker, a real daredevil, got back from the inner areas, brought something totally weird and made heaps of money… I could tell you hundreds of such stories myself!

I’ve seen them army choppers: get this, they flew right above us, and then straight to the Brain Burner! Well, I thought, now they’re gonna come raining down on us. But no, they flew further, turned around and flew back. Pretty cool, eh?
Now that we can go straight to the center… Imagine all the treasures lying about right there under your feet!
Now that there is an opportunity to get to the center of the Zone relatively easy, the stalkers are flocking there like flies on honey. Yeah, greed has never been the best part of human nature.

Now we’re gonna kick some ass! By the time all those guys from the bar, not to mention the border line, catch up, we’ll skim all the cream! We’re gonna get rich and they’ll have to do with the scraps.
Well, they say this Wish Granter really exists. Like someone has already found it and wished it out to the limit…
Listen, bud, I know all sorts of things happen in the Zone. Seen it with my own eyes. But all this babble about instant granting of wishes like owning a hotel in the Caribbean is total bullshit.

Don’t you know?! Two of our guys, those who rushed first to the center, actually made it to the Granter and made their wishes! They’d been dreaming about islands in the warm seas all their lives, well, they must be sunbathing somewhere in the tropics already!
Miklukha showed up, head of them Freedom guys. We all thought he had run off to the Big Land, but he actually managed to get by the Burner with a small group. Now that’s some macho!

A Freedom squad has been discovered in a previously inaccessible area. How did they manage to get through safely and survive here for several weeks? This is completely beyond me. It looks like we’ve underestimated these guys.
Get this, our Miklukha is back, safe and sound! Him and all the guys that had gone with him. They got through the Brain Burner and ended up sticking around here for a whole month, couldn’t get back.

Something weird is about to happen. They say the Duty chief, their bigwig, didn't go away on some regular business, but to make some deal with Freedom. What’s with all this shitty secrecy, why not make up out in the open! This whole thing stinks. On the other hand, stagers say when they fell to loggerheads it was over some bullshit. I hope these armchair freaks from the Big Land don’t get us all into some new slaughter…
Did you hear?! The army are after the swag, they’ll be here any minute! They heard the Burner’s conked out, and they’re in to scoop it all up!
We’ve just got the information: there’s a large-scale landing planned at the power plant by the army. Here’s my advice: if you want to score some swag, hurry up!

Now, we’ve got some mayhem! Right after the corridor opened, just as we started cleaning the station of all this shit, and here are the grunts, on call to sweep up all the swag! Not a tiny bit of decency left in them bastards…
I just can’t figure out how those Freedom guys lasted for a whole month here. Did they have a cape of invisibility or something? Now that blows me away big time!
You see what’s going on here? Well, I sure do have much more respect for Miklukha now! Just think of it: endure whole four weeks in that guano, and not lose a single one of his guys!
Some folks here have got a screw loose. And all strong guys, too, now dribbling like the worst of morons. Makes you think.

As you get closer to the station the unknown telepathic influence is getting stronger. Some have gone off their heads, others have had disorders and visions. Now may be just the right time to set back a little…

Listen, people are really going insane here. Someone will see a stone and start bellowing that it’s his artifact, he saw it first and the others would better keep away from it. Another one sees Jah himself in the clouds with arms around his mates that have been missing for eons… I’m telling you, something really dodgy is going on here.

The grunts have been up and running. Looking for something, digging… We used to see just a few choppers flying to Yantar, guarding the scientists and taking all the supplies and equipment to them. But now it's like an invasion! Raiding deep into the Zone, racing about in APCs. They’ve been to the Agroprom and to the Dark Valley, too. Weird stuff.

They say someone’s tried to get through the Burner. Real gone, no surprise, he’s pipped out… You haven’t heard about the Brain Burner? Are you kidding, man?! This is like the main bugaboo around here! And the worst thing is all the horrors they say about it, it’s all true.
On top of the bandits, the grunts have been hanging around here too. We used to get one chopper in a hundred years, and now they’re all over the Zone. Have they lost something?

I want to warn you, stalker. The military have been going wacko lately. They used to peacefully guard those scientists, but now they’re all up running around like headles chicken… And they’re not in a very peaceful disposition: they’ve shot some of your kind, and we have two wounded in a week.
Thank you very much.

What are you doing here unarmed and with no protection? Have you seen enough of life or something? Anomalies are behind every bush, zap and you’re done for! No one even goes wee-wee without protection, one moment and you got yourself a dose!

I see you’re not finding your bearings here yet, so let me give some friendly advice: stay away from the grunts. If you spot them, disppear as fast as you can. They really got no brains. They’ll shoot first and then search your corpse for papers to find out your name.
The Duty faction is bossing around here. Sort of like our gallant police, or something like that. Keep it in mind if you don’t want to get into trouble.
Good day.
Good afternoon.
Good afternoon, Sir!
Hey, mate!
Hello.
Well, hello there!
Hiya.
Greetings!
Hello, stalker.
Greetings, stalker.

You are on premises maintained by the members of Duty. Any demand of the patrol has to be carried out without questioning; you will be provided with necessary explanations. The rules are pretty simple, though: no tricks and everything will be a-ok.
Hey you, stalker!
Hey there.
Wow! Look who's here!
So who do we have here?
Hallo, man.

If you have any questions you better head straight to the bar, it’s right under your very nose! There you’ll hear all the stories, get all the answers, and they may ask you some questions too. I really don't have no time to waste now.
First time here? Then the bar is the place to go: your colleagues will tell you all the latest news.
Try not to get too close to the deadites. And don’t go to the laboratory, do you read me?
I wouldn’t recommend going near the lab: too many deadites.
You know, I would recommend that you to stay away from the lab complex.
Keep off those deadites, they’re dumb and not scared of anything. Stay away from the lab; it’s their breeding-ground or something of that kind…
Bear in mind: the Brain Burner is close by. Don’t even think about heading North.
Watch out, if you don’t want to lose your brains, don’t go North from here.
Careful across the bridge, OK? There’re packs of stray dogs over there. If you dawdle they’ll gobble you in two seconds.
Try and don’t lose your personality! The Burner is right near by; if you go North - zap and another idiot ready to be served.
It’s just like walking across a minefield, except it’s much worse. Hell knows what happens here at times, you can’t relax for a second.
I suggest you focus on the surroundings now and don’t think about relaxing. Once you do, you're as good as dead.
You’ve got to be all ears at all times! Sleep with one eye open! Some shit could happen any moment.
Watch out for the hell-raisers! This place is swarming with them like cockroaches!
Annihilate the Monolith men the moment you see them! They’re highly dangerous, real fanatics!

There’re some dolts here calling themselves the Monolith faction… whoever came up with the stupid name, that’s what they go by. Pain is nothing to them, and when they run out of ammo they charge at you going for your throat. So the moment you spot one shoot without hesitation.

Listen here. When you see the tunnel, don’t go in. I’m telling you right away because some find it difficult to realize that’s the real bummer. There’ll be nothing to carry out, you’ll be spluttered all over the walls. You’re in the Zone now, you get it?

And why are you empty-handed? Did you also run into those thugs under the bridge? The pricks! They nearly stripped me off naked. Took all of my swag! Look at them making a profit out of others… The bandits or the soldiers at the checkpoint - no difference.
What are doing walking all on your own? These skinheads are everywhere; you could get trapped any moment! They’ve been really asking for it lately, I hear they’ve attacked some checkpoints too.
I don’t know if you’re posted, but let me warn you: the bandits have been making quite a commotion here. Two skirmishes within a week. Watch out and stay alert, they’ve dispatched six loners already.
Do you happen to know what the grunts are up to at the R&D Institute? What’s with all this bustling about?
You’d better look out here. Some hell-raisers are hiding in the main building. Damn jackals, no shame, no compassion, if I could just smother them all with my own hands…
You really shouldn’t roam about the Dark Valley all alone. The bandits’ lair is right in one of those buildings; we just can’t smoke them out of there. So try to stay out of trouble, mate.
Help me, bud!
Somebody help me!
Guards, I'm wounded! Over here!
Help! I'm dying!
Throw me the medkit, guys!
I need a medkit!
Antishock, quick!
Guys, medkit needed!
Somebody give me a medkit!
The medkit, bud… medkit!
Help me, mate!
Can you share your medkit, mate?
